author: Karen Fratti
title: Stop what youâ€™re doing and turn up your speakers because Drake just dropped new music
text:
Stop what youâ€™re doing and turn up your speakers because Drake just dropped new music Aside from Queen Bey, Drake might be the one artist these days who really knows how to hype a new music release. Last October, the rapper teased the release of new tunes, but it wasnâ€™t until Saturday that Drake finally released his new project, More Life . It was sort of excruciating waiting, since Drizzy teased his fans with three tracks over the course of the past few months, offering up â€œSneakinâ€™,â€ featuring 21 Savage, â€œFake Love,â€ and â€œTwo Birds, One Stone,â€ which is a bit of a diss track aimed at Pusha T and Kid Cudi.
The project was supposed to start streaming on OVO Sound Radio (via Apple Beats 1) on Saturday at 6 p.m. ET, but there was a bit of a delay.
Twitter was not happy. Drake always delaying #MoreLife pic.twitter.com/BYAg3d8KLM 
â€” âœ¦ AZIZAH (@azizahrx) March 18, 2017 Waiting for more life to drop @Drake what's up pic.twitter.com/IrIVF2Cqhq 
â€” Loganâ¶ğ“…“ (@Mhiztur_logan) March 18, 2017 Listening to ovo sound radio like this isn't drake #morelife pic.twitter.com/DcxwTmJqu4 
â€” Young Savage TRAY (@Amadouuut2) March 18, 2017 Drake's clownin' all of us rn #MoreLife 
â€” Joseph Javahiryan (@joseph_java) March 18, 2017 Eventually, a half hour late, it started. Drake phoned in a message from London, thanking everyone for waiting (and ordering shots for the people who were with him). And it was totally worth the wait. The â€œplaylist,â€ as Drake is calling it, starts with â€œFree Smoke,â€ a song that includes shoutouts to J.Lo and Applebeeâ€™s. How could this be a bad project when it starts off like that?
Drake: "To each and every person listening, I truly do wish you more love, more blessings...and of course #MoreLife " #OVOSOUNDRADIO 
â€” Rap-Up (@RapUp) March 18, 2017 Drake explained the playlist concept to DJ Semtex in an interview in February, saying, â€œThe style in which itâ€™s being put together is based on the concept of OVO Sound Radio. Itâ€™s almost like a radio show .â€
He added,
â€œI basically asked myself â€˜What if I did it like OVO Sound Radio but every song was a new Drake song?â€™ Itâ€™s more like an evolution of a mixtape. After Views , I was inspired and I wanted to keep the music going and get people inspired.â€ After a lot of teasing with Instagram posts and other veiled social media hints ( Drake fans are the best for catching them all), the final drop on OVO Sound Radio and Apple Music on Saturday happened , and you can hear the whole album on OVO Radio (itâ€™s episode 39) . Unlike Views , which was only available through Apple Music for WAY TOO LONG , you can also hear More Life on Spotify and Amazon Music, according to Fader .
More Life pic.twitter.com/TK54NKaj8w 
â€” OVO Sound (@OVOSound) March 18, 2017 The 25 tracks are everything youâ€™ve come to love and respect about Drake (please see â€œGet It Togetherâ€ with Black Coffee and Jorja Smith). But weâ€™ll let you be the judge of this long-awaited project. Love him or hate him, you better brush up on More Life, because summer is just around the corner, and the whole album, er, PLAYLIST, is bound to be blasting from every car, roof, and someoneâ€™s earbuds standing next to you in Starbucks all season.
